result.execSummary:
The defendant Timothy Leonardo Moody was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>1-5g) [Modifiers: Use Dangerous Weapon (Felony 5+ Yrs)], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)1r.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court costs, fees, assessments, surcharges including DNA surcharge. Bail to apply. Any remaining balance to be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b).  . Any balance upon release to Extended supervison shall be due immediately. Failure to pay will result in an entry of civi judgment. Any remaining cash bail to be returned to the remitter.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain full time work.
No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
Participate in alcohol and drug assessment.  Successfully complete recommended treatment including drug and alcohol testing.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  No alcohol.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample if not already done so.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: firearm possession and voting.

Court advises the defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended and the the defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison. The Defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to Extended Supervision.  Any violations of those conditions may result in the defendant being returned to prison.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Timothy Leonardo Moody

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Order Concerning Sentence Adjustment signed and filed. tk 
Court orders the petition for sentence adjustment is DENIED.
Copies mailed to parties.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to Carolina Stark, Branch 17, for review. jbs
on count one.
Original Transcript (9 pages) commencing 09/12/2014 SENTENCING HEARING received and filed.

Defendant Timothy Leonardo Moody in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Defendant Timothy Leonardo Moody in custody.  Danielle E. Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
AS TO COUNT 1: 
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 36 MONTHS, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 25 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 12 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 24 MONTHS.  
Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, cash bail to apply. Any remaining balance is to paid through collection by the department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Any remaining balance upon release to extended supervision shall be due immediately; failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment. Any remaining cash bail to be returned to the remitter. 
Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program. 
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no alcohol.
- No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid 
  prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
  and successfully complete recommended treatment
  including drug and alcohol testing. 
- Seek and maintain full time work. 
- No possession of any firearms or weapons; fire ammunition. 
- No possession of any drug paraphernalia, used for personal use, manufacturing, or distribution of drugs. 
- Defendant may not possess cash greater than $200 at any one time. 
- No further violations of the law rising to the level of probable cause
-Provide a DNA sample, if not already done so. 
-Parenting class.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

Court advises the Defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended, and that the Defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison. The Defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to extended supervision, and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the Defendant being returned to prison. 

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 
Filed;
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
signed Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.
Letter to the Court filed pro-se, received.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department for Sentencing.

Defendant Timothy Leonardo Moody in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Defendant Timothy Leonardo Moody in custody.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case scheduled for Return on Warrant. Cash bail not previously ordered forfeited. Court orders cash bail to remain. Court orders case adjourned for Sentencing on 9-12-2014 at 2:45 p.m., Br. 17.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 12, 2014 at 02:45 pm.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department for Sentencing.

Defendant Timothy Leonardo Moody in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Defendant Timothy Leonardo Moody in custody.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case scheduled for a Return on Warrant. Cash bail was not previously ordered forfeited. Cash bail remains. Court orders case adjourned for Sentencing on 9-12-2014 at 2:45 p.m., Br. 17.
Bench warrant served. Original in Court file.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Michael L Chernin in court.  Paul M Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  Bail not forfeited at this time.

Defendant Timothy Leonardo Moody in court with attorney Michael L Chernin.  Hanna R Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  AMENDED INFORMATION WITHDRAWN.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 06-30-2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Timothy Leonardo Moody in court with attorney Michael L Chernin.  Danielle E Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amended information adding "Use of a Dangerous Weapon", 939.63(1)(b) Wis. Stats penalty enhancer filed 5-19-14.    Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Filed by the State (also on 5-19-14):  Witness List, Jury Instructions, Motion in Limine.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 2, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Timothy Leonardo Moody in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Hanna R. Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case adjourned for a Jury Trial and Final Pretrial in Branch 26.  Jury trial scheduled for June 4, 2014 at 09:00 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 20, 2014 at 08:30 am. Felony Pretrial Scheduling Order received, signed, and filed with court.

Defendant Timothy Leonardo Moody in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Paul Hauer for Danielle E. Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Status conference scheduled for 03-26-2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Timothy Leonardo Moody in court.  Dennis Murphy, appearing for Danielle E. Chojnacki, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is not eligible for Public Defender representation.  
Defendant informs Court he may be obtaining counsel; however counsel has not yet been retained.

Court orders case adjourned for CAUSE and case adjourned for status of counsel in Branch PE.
